intro: Pimelea urvilleana, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal heads, often appearing in spring. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Pimelea urvilleana is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions.
